Function.Description: The - Function returns the difference of its arguments.

Brief.Overview: The - Function returns the difference of its arguments. If the argument list contains only one argument, - returns its negative.
Brief.Overview-Complex: The - function subtracts forms the difference between a variety of numeric data types and a complex number as shown in the examples below.
Brief.Usage: The - function is used whenever it is necessary to compute the difference of a set of Numbers.
Brief.Usage-Complex: The - function is used to form the difference between numeric data types where at least one of the subtrahends is complex. Do not use if an immediate type, such as a real number, would suffice. Since complex numbers are heap objects, they require more space and operations on these types are slower than on immediate types.

Syntax.Return: Computes the difference of all the Numbers in the argument list.If the argument list contains only one argument, - function returns the negative of the Number

Syntax-Complex.Return: A numeric complex number holding the value of N1 less than the value of N2, N3, etc.
